title: 'Jared, you're a pervert': Walmart employee holds NOTHING back before publicly quitting over the intercom
description:
Every employee at some point in time has wanted to tell management where to stick it. Few do, and the ones who don't live vicariously through others. Audiences cheered when Jerry McGuire (and Jim Breuer) promised he wasn't going to do what we all thought he was going to do. Fans cheered when "Stone Cold" Steven Austin dropped Vince McMahon like the Board of Directors did twenty-five years later. And anyone who has ever worked in retail feels this lady's rant. Not sure what Walmart it is. Only know she doesn't work there anymore.

Also, I think Jared is going to get a call from corporate.

This woman is a savage! Love her 🤣 pic.twitter.com/pqo9LobffT
— Clown World ™ 🤡 (@ClownWorld_) December 29, 2022
To Jared, our store manager, you're a pervert.

To Gretta and Kathy, shame on you. I hope you don't talk to your families the way you talk to us.

F*ck management and f*ck this job. I quit.

When I was in her position, I never had an issue with management as much as the customers. And Walmart customers were extra Walmarty in 2022. Karen went bowling in the aisle while creaming about black lives and her p*ssy. Other Karen (who was of course wearing a mask) had a meltdown when a customer got within six feet of the self-checkout. Some creepy dude was caught lurking the day after he was released from jail as a sex offender. Then, every so often, the time for talk was done and the time for fists was now.

Whether it was a customer incident or an issue with management that acted as catalyst, everyone has a breaking point. Our friend here's breaking point was today. Or, whenever the video was recorded.

title: James Cameron doesn't want to fetishize guns. Anymore. Yes, the man who made millions on 'Terminator'
description:
With the release of Avatar 2, James Cameron can't help himself. If he can find a virtue, he's gonna signal it so bright it'll burn your retina. Shunning guns shouldn't surprise anyone. Like many Hollywood leftists who made a fortune "fetishizing" guns, he wants you to believe he is done with "fetishizing" guns.

So much so that he went through the trouble of filming ten expensive minutes of guns fetishizing for Avatar 2, just so he could cut it out of the movie.

“I actually cut about 10 minutes of the movie targeting gunplay action. I wanted to get rid of some of the ugliness, to find a balance between light and dark.”

Bro, you're responsible for Terminator. Go sit in the corner and shut up.

Maybe Hollywood's elite is in the midst of a contest of sorts. Where whoever scores the most woke points by the end of the year wins a prize. Because Cameron looks like he's in competition. He wants men to expel the dangerous toxin known as "testosterone" from our bodies. The filmmaker also can't understand why we don't see six-month pregnant women fighting bad guys in movies.

(It is unclear if James Cameron has ever met a woman who is six months pregnant. WikiPedia says he's been married five times and has four kids. But it's also Hollywood, so none of that means anything.)

Though Cameron has a high bar of wokeness to vault over. This is the man who once said Gal Gadot was too hot for Wonder Woman to be a feminist movie. A virtue he was so proud of signaling, he doubled down on it.

James Cameron is the latest lefty who made a fortune on gun movies wanting us to believe how embarrassed he is he made a fortune making gun movies. He should join the support group Seth Rogan and Jonah Hill have over their embarrassment of once making comedies.

title: Elon Musk roasts Anthony 'the Science' Fauci while hinting corporate media might be next target of 'Twitter Files'
description:
If we had to choose an MVP of 2022, it would be Elon Musk. From both an entertainment and content standpoint, Elon came in clutch. There was even one month when if you looked at our top ten posts, you would think they were sponsored by Tesla. As we prepare to forget old acquaintance by getting stinkin' drunk on the most overrated party night of the year, the Chief Twit may have provided a preview of what 2023 has in store.

The last time Elon said the words "Anthony Fauci," it was a foreshadowing of upcoming Twitter Files where we learned how "the science" took a backseat to "the narrative" at the behest of "the government." Elon confirms a new Twitter policy in 2023 on following science. More science, fewer false idols.

New Twitter policy is to follow the science, which necessarily includes reasoned questioning of the science
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 28, 2022


Anyone who says that questioning them is questioning science itself cannot be regarded as a scientist
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 28, 2022

More interesting are these comments about corporate media. There is a ton of wishcasting and handwringing over Elon Musk "ruining his reputation" by the way he has expressed opinions the left disagrees with. Musk has a warning...and perhaps a preview of new Twitter Files in 2023?

The legacy media should worry about its reputation. We have only just begun.
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) December 28, 2022

Corporate media isn't shy about demanding Big Tech censor, throttle, or otherwise deplatform their competition. Could there be a collection of emails and Slack screen captures exposing various media outlets? That's to be determined.

It just always cracks me up how corporate media refuses to believe they have anything to do with their reputation. As if it's only Trumpers and right-wing wackjobs who think they suck at life. The reality is it's the far-right, the center-right, RINOS, moderates, the establishment, the consultant class, independents, libertarians, and apolitical people. The only group that DOESN'T seem to think corporate media deserves its reputation as the least trusted institution in America is the far-left which relies on them to spread their narrative.

Corporate media earned their sh*tty reputation all on their own. They did that.

title: Watch: Meet 'Screwdolph,' the family-friendly drag queen who guides Santa's slay with his nipples in front of kids
description:
The latest family-friendly drag show exploded on the scenes for the holidays Wednesday night. "Drag Queen Christmas" performed before a sold-out, all-ages crowd (yes Virginia, that means children) in Orlando.

Traditionally, drag shows -- performances where men dress like women and get raunchy -- were for the entertainment of adults in bars. When those adults discovered they could get their fill of kink and raunch AND show off how "tolerant" and "inclusive" they were by subjecting their kids to it, "family-friendly" drag shows became all the rage in 2022! Though critics will tell you it's sick and gross and these parents should be ashamed of themselves.

The star performer was "Screwdolph," who guides Santa's slay with his nipples. To drive the point home to the children in attendance, they changed the words of a popular children's song.

A drag queen with illuminated breasts dances provocatively in front of children at a “family friendly” Drag Queen Christmas event in Orlando, Florida. pic.twitter.com/TmWwUW2HNM
— The Post Millennial (@TPostMillennial) December 29, 2022
SCREWdolph with your nipples so bright,
Won't you guide my slay tonight?

This video includes captions for those of you who are hearing impaired.

JUST IN: Children are in attendance of an Orlando drag show where performers are sexually dancing to the song 'Screwdolph' pic.twitter.com/JCBFQRjhkp
— Florida’s Voice (@FLVoiceNews) December 29, 2022

Also at this family-friendly drag performance -- where functioning adults exposed their children to adult entertainment in order to show other functioning adults how inclusive they are -- there was...honestly, I don't know what's going on here.

A drag queen “gives birth” in a bizarre explicit performance during a “family-friendly” Drag Queen Christmas event in Orlando, Florida. Children are in the audience. pic.twitter.com/LpJy6oVwWr
— The Post Millennial (@TPostMillennial) December 29, 2022

Florida's Department of Business and Professional Regulation threatened to pull the business licenses of places that invited minors to witness this --- what criticals call -- "filth." As of this writing, it is unclear if action is being taken.

When you think of it, "Drag Queen Christmas" is no different from the Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular. It's just that one focuses on the magic of Christmas. The other focuses on adult males putting flashlights where boobies would be and changing the name of a nursery rhyme to sexualize it.

What's the difference? If you can find one, feel free to explain in the comment section of whatever app brought you here.
